rsion":1}

returns._0: The constant base amount of BGT to be minted in the current block.
The parameter that determines the inflation cap.

computeReward(uint256,uint256,uint256,in.details: Returns 0 for boost == 0 even if conv == 0, since contract enforces conv > 0.

getMaxBGTPerBlock().details: Exposed for BGT contract to calculate the max burnable native token amount.

returns.amount: The maximum amount of BGT that can be minted in one block.

returns._0: The minimum amount of BGT to be minted in the current block.

processRewards(bytes,uint64,bool).details: This function can only be called by the distributor.If in genesis only base rate for validators is minted.

params.isReady: The flag to enable reward minting to distributor (true when BeraChef is ready).
params.nextTimestamp: The timestamp of the next beacon block that was processed.

returns._0: the amount of BGT minted to distributor.
The parameter that determines how fast the function converges to its max.
The unscaled amount of BGT to be minted in the current block.

setBaseRate(uint256).details: This function can only be called by the owner, which is the governance address.

setBoostMultiplier(uint256).details: This function can only be called by the owner, which is the governance address.

setDistributor(address).details: This function can only be called by the owner, which is the governance address.

setMinBoostedRewardRate(uint256).details: This function can only be called by the owner, which is the governance address.

params._minBoostedRewardRate: The new min boosted reward rate.

setRewardConvexity(uint256).details: This function can only be called by the owner, which is the governance address.

setRewardRate(uint256).details: This function can only be called by the owner, which is the governance address.

baseRate().notice: Returns the constant base rate for BGT.

boostMultiplier().notice: Returns the boost mutliplier param in the reward function.

computeReward(uint256,uint256,uint256,in.notice: Computes the reward given specified parameters, according to the formula. r := (1 + mul) * (1 - 1 / (1 + mul * boost^conv)) * rewardRate ∈ [0, mul * rewardRate]

getMaxBGTPerBlock().notice: Returns the current max BGT production per block.

minBoostedRewardRate().notice: Returns the minimum boosted reward rate for BGT.

processRewards(bytes,uint64,bool).notice: Processes the rewards for the specified block and mints BGT to validator's operator and distributor.

rewardConvexity().notice: Returns the reward convexity param in the reward function.

rewardRate().notice: Returns the reward rate for BGT.

setBaseRate(uint256).notice: Sets the constant base reward rate for BGT.

setBoostMultiplier(uint256).notice: Sets the boost multiplier parameter for the reward formula.

setDistributor(address).notice: Sets the distributor contract that receives the minted BGT.

setMinBoostedRewardRate(uint256).notice: Sets the min boosted reward rate for BGT.

setRewardConvexity(uint256).notice: Sets the reward convexity parameter for the reward formula.

setRewardRate(uint256).notice: Sets the reward rate for BGT.

@notice Returns the constant base rate for BGT.
 @return The constant base amount of BGT to be minted in the current block.

@notice Returns the reward rate for BGT.
 @return The unscaled amount of BGT to be minted in the current block.

@notice Returns the minimum boosted reward rate for BGT.
 @return The minimum amount of BGT to be minted in the current block.

@notice Returns the boost mutliplier param in the reward function.
 @return The parameter that determines the inflation cap.

@notice Returns the reward convexity param in the reward function.
 @return The parameter that determines how fast the function converges to its max.
